title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 3 points:

1 point: For an expression of Gauss’s Law

Q i ϵ 0 = ∮ E ⋅ d A

1 point: For a correct intermediate step indicating that the area of the Gaussian surface is 4 π r 2

Q i ϵ 0 = E ( 4 π r 2 )

1 point: For a correct final expression, specifically using Qi

E ( r ) = 1 4 π ϵ 0 Q i r 2  or  E ( r ) = k Q i r 2
descriptions:

1 point: For a correct intermediate step indicating that the area of the Gaussian surface is 4 π r 2

Q i ϵ 0 = E ( 4 π r 2 )

1 point: For a correct final expression, specifically using Qi

E ( r ) = 1 4 π ϵ 0 Q i r 2  or  E ( r ) = k Q i r 2

Q i ϵ 0 = E ( 4 π r 2 )

1 point: For a correct final expression, specifically using Qi

E ( r ) = 1 4 π ϵ 0 Q i r 2  or  E ( r ) = k Q i r 2

The response earns two of the following points:

Q i ϵ 0 = ∮ E ⋅ d A

1 point: For a correct intermediate step indicating that the area of the Gaussian surface is 4 π r 2

Q i ϵ 0 = E ( 4 π r 2 )

1 point: For a correct final expression, specifically using Qi

E ( r ) = 1 4 π ϵ 0 Q i r 2  or  E ( r ) = k Q i r 2

The response earns all of the following points:

1 point: For an expression of Gauss’s Law

Q i ϵ 0 = ∮ E ⋅ d A

1 point: For a correct intermediate step indicating that the area of the Gaussian surface is 4 π r 2

Q i ϵ 0 = E ( 4 π r 2 )

1 point: For a correct final expression, specifically using Qi

E ( r ) = 1 4 π ϵ 0 Q i r 2  or  E ( r ) = k Q i r 2

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 2 points:

1 point: For indicating that the enclosed charge is the sum of the inner and outer charges

Q i + Q 0 ϵ 0 = ∮ E ⋅ d A

1 point: For a correct expression for the electric field

E ( r ) = 1 4 π ϵ 0 ( Q i + Q 0 ) r 2

Note: The correct expression by itself earns both points.

The response earns both of the following points:

1 point: For indicating that the enclosed charge is the sum of the inner and outer charges

Q i + Q 0 ϵ 0 = ∮ E ⋅ d A

1 point: For a correct expression for the electric field

E ( r ) = 1 4 π ϵ 0 ( Q i + Q 0 ) r 2 Note: The correct expression by itself earns both points.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 2 points:

1 point: For using the integral definition of potential in terms of electric field

V ( r ) − V ∞ = − ∫ ∞ r E ⋅ d r

V ( r ) = − ∫ ∞ r 1 4 π ϵ 0 ( Q i + Q 0 ) r 2 d r

V ( r ) = − ( Q i + Q 0 ) 4 π ϵ 0 [ − 1 r ] ∞ r

1 point: For the correct expression

V ( r ) = 1 4 π ϵ 0 ( Q i + Q 0 ) r

Note: The correct expression by itself earns both points.

Alternate Solution:

Outside the shells, the charges on each can be treated as point charges at their centers.

1 point: For using the concept of summation of point charge potentials

V ( r ) = 1 4 π ϵ 0 ∑ j q j r J

V ( r ) = 1 4 π ϵ 0 ⟮ Q i r + Q 0 r ⟯

1 point: For the correct expression (the correct expression by itself earns both points)

V ( r ) = 1 4 π ϵ 0 ( Q i + Q 0 ) r

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 1 point:

The answer from part (c), with QT = QI + Q0, can be solved for QT . Values at the outer shell are then used to determine a numerical value.

1 point: For correct work resulting in the correct value, with units

V ( r ) = 1 4 π ϵ 0 Q T r , r ≥ 0.20  m

Q T = 4 π ϵ 0 r V ( r ) = ( ( 0.20  m ) ( 100  V ) ( 9.0 × 10 9  N ⋅ m 2 / C 2 ) )

Q T = 2.2 × 10 − 9  C

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 3 points:

1 point: For a segment indicating an E-field of 0 for r < 0.10 m, explicitly drawn

1 point: For a segment that is concave down and negative for 0.10 m < r < 0.20 m

1 point: For a segment that is concave up and positive for r > 0.20 m. The line must not touch or cross the horizontal axis.

Note: The labels on the vertical axis are not to scale and are not required to receive full credit.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
The response can earn up to 4 points:

1 point: For a continuous set of segments that have slope discontinuities at r = 0.10 m and at r = 0.20 m

1 point: For a segment indicating a constant negative potential for r < 0.10 m

1 point: For a segment that is increasing, concave down, and crosses the r axis, for 0.10 m < r < 0.20 m

1 point: For a segment that is concave up and positive for r > 0.20 m. The line must not touch or cross the horizontal axis.

Note: The labels on the vertical axis are not scored and are not required to receive full credit.
